actor_awards.notes: A highly respected stage actress who made few films but left a lasting impact. Won both the Academy Award and Golden Globe for Best Supporting Actress for 'Harvey' (1950). Famous for her roles in the stage and screen versions of 'Arsenic and Old Lace' and 'Harvey'.

filmography.title: Harvey
filmography.role_description: The frazzled and socially conscious sister of Elwood P. Dowd, who tries to have him committed but ends up being committed herself.
filmography.plot: Elwood P. Dowd is a mild-mannered man who claims to have an invisible 6-foot-3.5-inch rabbit friend named Harvey, much to the embarrassment of his social-climbing sister.

filmography.title: Arsenic and Old Lace
filmography.role_description: One of two sweet, elderly sisters who murder lonely old men with elderberry wine as a 'charity' to end their suffering.
filmography.plot: A drama critic learns on his wedding day that his beloved maiden aunts are homicidal maniacs, and that insanity runs in his family.

filmography.title: The Lady from Texas
filmography.role_description: An eccentric Civil War widow who is deemed incompetent by the town, leading a cowboy to come to her aid.
filmography.plot: A charmingly eccentric old lady is threatened with being committed to an asylum so her relatives can get her ranch.

filmography.title: After Tomorrow
filmography.role_description: The nagging and interfering mother of the protagonist, preventing the couple's happiness.
filmography.plot: A young couple's marriage plans are constantly thwarted by their dependent and meddling mothers.

filmography.title: Careless Lady
filmography.role_description: The aunt of a naive wallflower who travels to Paris to find adventure.
filmography.plot: A shy small-town girl pretends to have had an affair in Paris to make herself more interesting to the boys back home.

filmography.title: The Bishop's Candlesticks
filmography.role_description: The Bishop's sister in this early sound short film adaptation of 'Les Misérables'.
filmography.plot: An escaped convict steals candlesticks from a Bishop who has treated him with kindness.

filmography.title: The United States Steel Hour: The Meanest Man in the World
filmography.role_description: A character in this TV anthology adaptation of the play. (TV Episode)
filmography.plot: A kind-hearted lawyer tries to become mean to succeed in business but finds it goes against his nature.

filmography.title: Ford Theatre: Arsenic and Old Lace
filmography.role_description: Hull reprises her legendary stage and screen role for this television production.
filmography.plot: The television adaptation of the classic play about two sweet aunts who poison lonely old men.

filmography.title: Lux Video Theatre: The Valet
filmography.role_description: A role in the Lux Video Theatre anthology series. (TV Episode)
filmography.plot: An anthology episode featuring Hull in a leading character role.

filmography.title: Lux Video Theatre: Miss Mabel
filmography.role_description: The title character in this teleplay.
filmography.plot: A gentle elderly woman forges a will to ensure money goes to worthy causes, leading to complications.

filmography.title: Lux Video Theatre: A Bouquet for Miss Bundy
filmography.role_description: A lonely woman who receives unexpected attention.
filmography.plot: An anthology drama centered around the character of Miss Bundy.

filmography.title: Schlitz Playhouse: The Autograph
filmography.role_description: An elderly woman involved in a story about a valuable autograph.
filmography.plot: A story involving a rare autograph and the people vying for it.

filmography.title: Lights Out: The Man with the Watch
filmography.role_description: A suspenseful role in the popular sci-fi/horror anthology series.
filmography.plot: A mysterious man with a watch that can stop time visits a boarding house.

filmography.title: Studio One: The Romance of Henry Menafee
filmography.role_description: The mother of the protagonist in this live television drama.
filmography.plot: A man tries to find romance despite the interference of his life circumstances.

filmography.title: Pontiac Presents Playwrights '56: The Day the Trains Stopped Running
filmography.role_description: One of her final acting roles in this television anthology.
filmography.plot: A drama about a suburban community facing a crisis when the commuter trains stop running.
